metadata.title: CVE-2016-2042 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS 18.04 LTS (bionic) - low
metadata.description:
phpMyAdmin 4.4.x before 4.4.15.3 and 4.5.x before 4.5.4 allows remoteattackers to obtain sensitive information via a crafted request to (1)libraries/phpseclib/Crypt/AES.php or (2)libraries/phpseclib/Crypt/Rijndael.php, which reveals the full path in anerror message.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-2042` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

phpmyadmin - 4:4.5.4-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: phpmyadmin package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4:4.5.4-1').
